alert.note: Alert for Madison; Onondaga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 1:08PM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Lake effect snow expected starting tonight. Snowfall of 1 to 5 inches through Monday morning, highest along and north of the Thruway. Snow may start as a squall with winds gusting over 30 mph at times. The main snow band may drift north on Monday before returning Monday night with additional accumulation of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Onondaga and Madison counties. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 1 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for New York can be found at 511ny.org or by dialing 5 1 1 from within the state.
